utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Never call me from that phone.

utterance.content: OK, here we go. Honey, I'm sorry, they were all out of apple pie, someone just got the last piece.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God. You are not gonna believe this. I have just been discovered.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Now wait a minute, I claimed you in the name of France four years ago.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Anyway, OK, now promise you won't like, freak out and say how great this is until I'm done, OK.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK. I just met this producer of this like, teeny record company, who said that I have a very fresh, offbeat sound and she wants to do a demo of Smelly Cat.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I told you not to do that yet. And, she wants to do a video.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm not done yet, OK. God. OK, if that goes well, they may even want to make an album.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm done now.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh God. Ross, OK, if you care about me at all, you will get the pie out of the man's hood.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Get the what?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Pie in the hood, pie in the hood. Go.

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: What're you doing?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'm sorry, my pie was, was in your hood. Now I just have to get the coffee out of that guy's pants and I'll be back in the hospital by 7.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Damnit Ross, get your butt out of the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Calm down, I'm blow drying.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Blow drying what, you have no hair.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What's goin' on?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Your boyfriend has been in there for over an hour. I can't believe it, it's like I'm living with him again. He's here when I go to sleep, he's here when I wake up, he's here when I want to use the shower, ughh. It's like I'm sixteen all over again .

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, you're not sixteen, you're both adults now.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: GET OUT YOU DUFUS!!

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Or ya know, he's rubber and you're glue.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: All yours.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I hope you cleaned your hair out of the drain.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I hope you cleaned your hair out of the drain.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Cut it out.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Mi-mi-mii.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I've never wanted you more.

utterance.content: So, whaddya say boys, should I call him? Well, ya know what they say. Ask your slippers a question... you're going crazy.

utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.content: Yeah well, I hear the place looks great.

utterance.content: Ahh, forget about it, I'm havin' a ball. How's the apartment doin'

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh hey, it's, it's terriffic. I mean it's a regular space... fest.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, well great.

utterance.content: Yeah I just... wanted to call and say hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well OK then. Was that the oven timer?

utterance.content: That's right my friend. It's time for...

utterance.content: Baywatch!!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, can you believe they gave Stephanie skin cancer?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I still can't believe they promoted her to lieutenant.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Naa, you're just sayin' that 'cause you're in love with Yasmine Blepe.

utterance.content: Well, how could anyone not be in love with Yasmine Blepe?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, hey, they're runnin'

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: See, this is the brilliance of the show. I say always keep them running. All the time, running. Run. Run Yasmine, run like the wind.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: But I thought you wanted to live by yourself.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I did. I thought it'd be great. I figured I'd have like, time alone with my thoughts but, ya know, it turns out I don't have as many thoughts as you'd think.

utterance.content: Joey, why don't you talk to Chandler about moving back?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Look, I know you don't want to hear this right now but, we've seen him in his new place, alright. And he's happy, he's, he's decorated.

utterance.content: Wait hold on Tony, hold on. Hello. Hi, yeah no, she's right here. Um hold on. Hi Tony, can I call you back? That's uh, that's my sister's boyfriend.

utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.content: Well you know, we got to talking and uh, he said he needed a place and I had a spare room.

utterance.content: Now OK, I haven't seen it yet so, if you don't like it, well, so what, none of you ever made a video. OK.

utterance.content: I sound amazing. I, I, I've never heard myself sing before. I mean, except in my own head. Oh, this is so cool, now I can hear what you hear.

utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.content: Oh it's uh, over there on the table.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, Eddie likes to keep it over there.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Alright, here you go my friend. Eggs a-la Eddie, huh?

utterance.content: Oh, ooh.

utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.content: No I just uh, thought you liked your eggs with the bread with the hole in the middle, a-la me.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well I do, but uh, Eddie makes them this way and, well they're pretty darn good.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Well you guys, I'm outta here. See ya pals.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: See ya.

utterance.content: So how you two gettin' along?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, I couldn't be happier.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Great, well, I'm happy for ya. Alright that's it. He just comes in here, Mr. Jonny Neweggs, with his, his, his movin' the mail and his, his 'see ya pals'. And now there's no juice. There's no juice f or the people who need the juice and want the juice. I need the juice.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: There's another carton right over there.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, this isn't about juice anymore, alright man.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright, so what's it about?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Eggs. Who's eggs do you like better, his or mine, huh?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well I like both eggs equally.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh come on. Nobody likes two different kinds of eggs equally. You like one better than the other and I wanna know which.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well what's the difference? Your eggs aren't here anymore, are they? You took your eggs and you left. You really expect me to never find new eggs?

utterance.content: Bite me.

utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, Monica keeps changin' the channel.

utterance.content: Oh that's great, why don't you tell mommy on me.

utterance.content: Now I'm mommy in this little play? Alright look, I refuse to get sucked into this like, weird little Geller dimension thing OK. So I'm gonna go and take a nice long hot bubble bath because you kids are driving me crazy.

utterance.content: Ow, ow, OK. Alright, alright, Mon, Mon, you've gone ultrasonic again, alright.

utterance.content: Why, why, why can't you stand me being here? I don't, I, we're just, ya know, we're just havin' fun.

utterance.content: Fun? Fun, you think this is fun?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, c'mon I mean I though, you know, I thought we're just foolin' around. Like when, uh, when we were kids.

utterance.content: Ross, I hated you when we were kids.

utterance.content: You hated me when we were kids?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yes. I hated you. I mean I, I, loved you in a 'you're my brother so I have to' kind of way, but basically, yeah, I hated your guts.

utterance.content: Why did you hate me?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Because, you were mean to me and you, you teased me and you always, always got your way.

utterance.content: And that wasn't fun for you?

utterance.content: Duh-huh!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I can't believe you hated me.

utterance.content: Now I love you. And not just 'cause I have to.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.content: Yeah. You're just gonna have to stop pissing me off.

utterance.content: I can do that.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Then I won't have to kill you.

utterance.content: Yeah, thanks. You know what?
